Yes, there have been efforts to address the negative consequences of the mining industry in San Luis Potosí. In recent years, there has been increased awareness of the environmental impacts of mining on local communities and ecosystems, leading to the adoption of stricter regulations and the development of more sustainable mining practices.

Additionally, there have been initiatives to address the economic and social inequalities created by the industry, such as community development programs and efforts to support local small-scale mining operations. These programs aim to create more equitable economic opportunities for communities affected by mining, and to promote more sustainable and inclusive development in the region.

However, there is still a long way to go in addressing the negative impacts of the mining industry in San Luis Potosí, and many local communities continue to face challenges related to environmental pollution, economic inequality, and social unrest. Ongoing efforts to promote sustainable mining practices and to support community development will be key to creating a more just and sustainable future for the region.
